ygData.subject: Re: Pets
ygData.msgSnippet: The level 29 pet gets duel wield, however only if you give it 2 *different* weapons I usually give him a magician s summoned dagger so he can hit magical
ygData.messageBody:
The level 29 pet gets duel wield, however only if you give it 2 *different*
weapons I usually give him a magician's summoned dagger so he can hit
magical creatures just in case, and if I have one handy, a fine steel for
the off hand. To be honest I don't know if it makes him faster or not, but
it certainly seems like he is. :)


> From: Lomack <lomack@...>
>
> Ok I have had this question for awhile. I suppose some of you high level
> necros can probably help here.
>
> When I was in the low levels everyone told me it was always best to give
my
> pet a rusty weapon to help it do more damage when it attacked.
> I was told that once I got the 12th level pets that giving them weapons
was
> bad because they hit for more damage and more often without a weapon.
> Lately I have been seeing many high level necros giving their pets a fine
> steel dagger.
> So here are the questions.
> 1) do you only give the pet a FS dagger if you KNOW the stuff it will be
> attacking can always be hit by non magic weapons?
> 2) Can you give the pet more than one dagger since it can double attack
> and duel weild at higher levels?
> 3) At what level does giving a pet a FS dagger become more benificial
than
> letting it use its fists?
> 4) If pets do get the double attack and duel weild what level pet can I
> give more than one weapon two?
> 5) I understand that the FS dagger is used because of its low delay. Is
> any other weapon a good alternate choice if a FS dagger is not available?
> 6) At Very High levels where money is really not much of a factor, would
it
> be even better to buy up inexpensive magic weapons (inexensive for a level
> 44+) like the tenticle wips for your pet?
>
> Thanks in advance
